trans-unit.source: The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.PropertyAccessRule"></xref> class represents a specific type of access rule that is used to allow or deny access to an Active Directory Domain Services property.
This class is provided to simplify construction of an access rule for an Active Directory Domain Services property.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.PropertyAccessRule"></xref> class with the specified identity reference, access control type, and property access.
When you use this constructor, it creates a property access rule that applies to all property types.
An <xref href="System.Security.Principal.IdentityReference"></xref> object that identifies the trustee of the access rule.
One of the <xref href="System.Security.AccessControl.AccessControlType"></xref> enumeration values that specifies the access rule type.
One of the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.PropertyAccess"></xref> enumeration values that specifies the property access type.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.PropertyAccessRule"></xref> class with the specified identity reference, access control type, property access, and Active Directory Domain Services security inheritance.
When you use this constructor, it creates a property access rule that applies to all property types.
An <xref href="System.Security.Principal.IdentityReference"></xref> object that identifies the trustee of the access rule.
One of the <xref href="System.Security.AccessControl.AccessControlType"></xref> enumeration values that specifies the access rule type.
One of the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.PropertyAccess"></xref> enumeration values that specifies the property access type.
One of the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectorySecurityInheritance"></xref> enumeration values that specifies the inheritance type of the access rule.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.PropertyAccessRule"></xref> class with the specified identity reference, access control type, property access, and property type.
An <xref href="System.Security.Principal.IdentityReference"></xref> object that identifies the trustee of the access rule.
One of the <xref href="System.Security.AccessControl.AccessControlType"></xref> enumeration values that specifies the access rule type.
One of the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.PropertyAccess"></xref> enumeration values that specifies the property access type.
The schema GUID of the property that this access rule applies to.
If this is <xref href="System.Guid.Empty"></xref>, then the access rule applies to all property types.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.PropertyAccessRule"></xref> class with the specified identity reference, access control type, property access, Active Directory Domain Services security inheritance, and inherited object type.
When you use this constructor, it creates a property access rule that applies to all property types.
An <xref href="System.Security.Principal.IdentityReference"></xref> object that identifies the trustee of the access rule.
One of the <xref href="System.Security.AccessControl.AccessControlType"></xref> enumeration values that specifies the access rule type.
One of the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.PropertyAccess"></xref> enumeration values that specifies the property access type.
One of the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectorySecurityInheritance"></xref> enumeration values that specifies the inheritance type of the access rule.
The schema GUID of the child object type that can inherit this access rule.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.PropertyAccessRule"></xref> class with the specified identity reference, access control type, property access, property type, and Active Directory Domain Services security inheritance.
An <xref href="System.Security.Principal.IdentityReference"></xref> object that identifies the trustee of the access rule.
One of the <xref href="System.Security.AccessControl.AccessControlType"></xref> enumeration values that specifies the access rule type.
One of the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.PropertyAccess"></xref> enumeration values that specifies the property access type.
The schema GUID of the property that this access rule applies to.
If this is <xref href="System.Guid.Empty"></xref>, then the access rule applies to all property types.
One of the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectorySecurityInheritance"></xref> enumeration values that specifies the inheritance type of the access rule.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.PropertyAccessRule"></xref> class with the specified identity reference, access control type, property access, property type, Active Directory Domain Services security inheritance, and inherited object type.
An <xref href="System.Security.Principal.IdentityReference"></xref> object which identifies the trustee of the access rule.
One of the <xref href="System.Security.AccessControl.AccessControlType"></xref> enumeration values which specifies the access rule type.
One of the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.PropertyAccess"></xref> enumeration values that specifies the property access type.
The schema GUID of the property that this access rule applies to.
If this is <xref href="System.Guid.Empty"></xref>, then the access rule applies to all property types.
One of the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectorySecurityInheritance"></xref> enumeration values that specifies the inheritance type of the access rule.
The schema GUID of the child object type that can inherit this access rule.
